name: letter
default_checktext: You open the letter, and read it for what feels like the hundreth time.
Your eyes skim over the text as a formality. You know what it says.
Uncle Henry, last living relative, old house.
At first you couldn't believe your luck.
This is the kind of thing that only happens in movies.
Yeah, this feels more like the kind of luck you expected.
At the bottom of the letter, the lawyer drew a crude map of the
driveway, circling a small pile of rocks. He said he hid
the key there for you. You think to yourself, at that point,
he could have just put it in the envelope.

name: newspaper
default_checktext: You've had enough bad news, you figure the
newspapers can stay where they are for now.

name: rock
default_checktext: The rocks are piled in a crude mound
toppled_checktext: You sift through the rocks, hoping the lawyer left
some kind of further instructions, but find nothing.
You wonder if this was some kind of sick joke.

name: key
default_checktext: The lawyer told you this key would get you into almost any lock on the property.
From the looks of the front door, so would a good kick.

name: door
default_checktext: You try the doorknob, half expecting it to come off in your hand.
unlocked_checktext: The old hinges on this door appear to have given out.
For now, the door is stuck open.
